original: Theravāda Vinaya
analyzed: thera vāda vinaya
translated: The Pāṭimokkha of the Theravāda Vinaya

original: Mahāvibhaṅga🔽Pācittiyakaṇḍa🔽Ratanavagga
analyzed: mahāvibhaṅga  pācittiyakaṇḍa  ratana vagga
translated: The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on offenses entailing confession🔽The sub-chapter on the precious things

original: 86. Sūcigharasikkhāpada
translated: The training rule on needle cases

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṁ nigrodhārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmin nigrodha ārāme
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying in the Sakyan country, in the Banyan Tree Monastery in Kapilavatthu.

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarena dantakārena bhikkhū pavāritā honti—
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññatarena dantakārena bhikkhū pavāritāḥ honti
translated: On one occasion a certain ivory worker had invited the monks,

original: “yesaṁ ayyānaṁ sūcigharena attho ahaṁ sūcigharenā”ti.
analyzed: yesam ayyānam sūcigharena atthaḥ aham sūcigharena ati
translated: saying, “If any of you need a needle case, I’ll make one for you.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bahū sūcighare viññāpenti.🔽Yesaṁ khuddakā sūcigharā te mahante sūcighare viññāpenti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū bahū sūci ghare viññāpenti  yesam khuddakā sūcigharā te mahante sūcighare viññāpenti
translated: At that time the monks asked for many needle cases.🔽Those who had small needle cases asked for large ones,

original: Yesaṁ mahantā sūcigharā te khuddake sūcighare viññāpenti.
analyzed: yesam mahantā sūcigharā te khuddake sūcighare viññāpenti
translated: and those who had large needle cases asked for small ones.

original: Atha kho so dantakāro bhikkhūnaṁ bahū sūcighare karonto na sakkoti aññaṁ vikkāyikaṁ bhaṇḍaṁ kātuṁ, attanāpi na yāpeti, puttadāropissa kilamati.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ dantakāraḥ bhikkhūnam bahū sūci ghare karontaḥ na sakkoti aññam vikkāyikam bhaṇḍam kātu attanā api na yāpeti putta dāropissa kilamati
translated: As a consequence, that ivory worker was unable to make other salable goods. He was unable to support himself, and his wife and children suffered.

original: Manussā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: manussāḥ ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: People complained and criticized him,🔽“How can the Sakyan monastics do this?

original: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā na mattaṁ jānitvā bahū sūcighare viññāpessanti.
analyzed: kathan hi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyāḥ na mattam jānitvā bahū sūcighare viññāpessanti
translated: “How can the Sakyan monastics not know moderation and ask for many needles and thread?

original: Ayaṁ imesaṁ bahū sūcighare karonto na sakkoti aññaṁ vikkāyikaṁ bhaṇḍaṁ kātuṁ, attanāpi na yāpeti, puttadāropissa kilamatī”ti.
analyzed: ayam imesam bahū sūcighare karontaḥ na sakkoti aññam vikkāyikam bhaṇḍam kātu attanā api na yāpeti putta dāropissa kilamati iti
translated: He’s making so many needles and thread that he can’t make anything else to sell. He can’t even support himself, and his wife and children are suffering.”

original: Assosuṁ kho bhikkhū tesaṁ manussānaṁ ujjhāyantānaṁ khiyyantānaṁ vipācentānaṁ.
analyzed: assosum kho bhikkhū tesam manussānam ujjhāyantānam khiyyantānam vipācentāna
translated: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

original: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū na mattaṁ jānitvā bahū sūcighare viññāpessantī”ti …pe…
analyzed: kathan hi nāma bhikkhū na mattam jānitvā bahū sūci ghare viññāpessanti iti pe
translated: “How can monks not know moderation and ask for many needles and thread?” …

original: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na mattaṁ jānitvā bahū sūcighare viññāpentī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave bhikkhū na mattam jānitvā bahū sūci ghare viññāpenti iti
translated: “Is it true, monks, that monks are doing this?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti.
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

original: Vigarahi buddho bhagavā …pe…
analyzed: vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān pe
translated: The Buddha rebuked them, …

original: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā na mattaṁ jānitvā bahū sūcighare viññāpessanti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma te bhikkhave mogha purisāḥ na mattam jānitvā bahū sūci ghare viññāpessanti
translated: “Foolish men, how can you not know moderation and ask for many needles and thread?

original: Netaṁ, bhikkhave, appasannānaṁ vā pasādāya …pe…
analyzed: na ita bhikkhave appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: This won’t inspire confidence in those without it …🔽And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

original: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ uddiseyyātha—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave imam sikkhāpadam uddiseyyātha
translated: And in this way, monks, you should recite this training rule:

original: “Yo pana bhikkhu aṭṭhimayaṁ vā dantamayaṁ vā visāṇamayaṁ vā sūcigharaṁ kārāpeyya bhedanakaṁ, pācittiyan”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ pana bhikkhu aṭṭhi mayam vā danta mayam vā visāṇa mayam vā sūci gharam kārāpeyya bhedanaka pācittiyanti
translated: ‘If a monk has a pin-making machine made that has a metal point, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: Yo panāti
analyzed: yaḥ panāti
translated: If a monk:

original: yo yādiso …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ ya ādisaḥ pe
translated: if he is of such a kind, and so on.

original: bhikkhūti🔽…pe… ayaṁ imasmiṁ atthe adhippeto bhikkhūti.
analyzed: bhikkhū ti  pe ayam imasmin atthe adhippetaḥ bhikkhu iti
translated: Monk:🔽the meaning is as in the previous rule.

original: Aṭṭhi nāma
analyzed: aṭṭhi nāma
translated: Metal:

original: yaṁ kiñci aṭṭhi.🔽Danto nāma🔽hatthidanto vuccati.
analyzed: yam kiñci aṭṭhi  dantaḥ nāma  hatthi dantaḥ vuccati
translated: whatever is made of metal.

original: Visāṇaṁ nāma🔽yaṁ kiñci visāṇaṁ.🔽Kārāpeyyāti
analyzed: visāṇam nāma  yam kiñci visāṇa  kārāpeyyā iti
translated: Has a pin-making machine made:

original: karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṁ.🔽Paṭilābhena bhinditvā pācittiyaṁ desetabbaṁ.🔽Attanā vippakataṁ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
analyzed: karoti vā vā payoge dukkaṭa  paṭilābhena bhinditvā pācittiyam desetabba  attanā vippakatam attanā pariyosāpeti āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: if he makes one himself, or has one made, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.🔽When he obtains it, he should confess an offense entailing confession for breaking it.🔽If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Attanā vippakataṁ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Parehi vippakataṁ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
analyzed: attanā vippakatam parehi pariyosāpeti āpatti pācittiyassa  parehi vippakatam attanā pariyosāpeti āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Parehi vippakataṁ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
analyzed: parehi vippakatam parehi pariyosāpeti āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Aññassatthāya karoti vā kārāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: aññassa atthāya karoti vā kārāpeti vā āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If he makes one or has one made for the benefit of someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Aññena kataṁ paṭilabhitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: aññena katam paṭilabhitvā paribhuñjati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If he uses one made by someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Anāpatti—🔽gaṇṭhikāya,
analyzed: anāpatti  gaṇṭhikāya
translated: There is no offense if🔽he makes a string-holder;

original: araṇike,🔽vidhe,🔽añjaniyā,
analyzed: araṇike  vidhe  añjaniyā
translated: if he makes a strainer;🔽if he makes a container;

original: añjanisalākāya,🔽vāsijaṭe,
analyzed: añjani salākāya  vāsi jaṭe
translated: if he makes an ointment stick;🔽if he makes an ointment stick container;

original: udakapuñchaniyā,
analyzed: udaka puñchaniyā
translated: if he makes a water strainer;

original: ummattakassa,
analyzed: ummattakassa
translated: if he is insane;

original: ādikammikassāti.🔽Sūcigharasikkhāpadaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: ādikammikassa ati 🔽sūcighara sikkhāpadam niṭṭhitam catuttha
translated: if he is the first offender.🔽The training rule on needle cases, the fourth, is finished.
